meanings.sent1: She was tensing her muscles before the race.
meanings.sent2: He always starts tensing up before giving a speech.
meanings.sent3: The cat was tensing its body, ready to pounce on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere in the room was tensing up as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the upcoming exam was tensing her nerves.

meanings.definition: The act of making or becoming tense.
meanings.sent1: His tensing of the jaw indicated his frustration.
meanings.sent2: The tensing of her shoulders showed her discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The sudden tensing of the rope caused it to snap.
meanings.sent4: The tensing of the crowd's energy could be felt in the air.
meanings.sent5: The tensing of the situation made everyone uneasy.
